IRS990.MissionDescription: To be an innovative, effective, and responsive community mental health center for Jefferson County.
IRS990.Description: Substance Abuse Treatment. The organization provides adults and youths with outpatient assessment and counseling for substance abuse. CSTAR provides care for adults and youths. Total clients served for the year was approximately 2569.

Activity2.Description: Youth Services. Psychiatric counseling for youths and programs through local schools for youths. Total clients served for the year was approximately 1,901.

Activity3.Description: Clinical Services. Outpatient therapy for adults, families, youths and children with various mental health concerns is provided. Families First, Divorce Mediation, Crime Victim Services and Childrens First are among the programs offered. Total clients served for the year was approximately 2,759.

ActivityOther.Description: Community Support. Outpatient Rehabilitative programs for those with mental illness is provided. Outpatient and residential treatment for mental illness is provided. Adult day care facilities are also provided. Total clients served for the year was approximately 530.
Child Advocacy Center.A child focused program which serves as a community resource and supports agencies that respond to child abuse. Total clients served for the year was approximately 491.

Loss on disposal of assets other than inventory: 2568.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: Jerry Rogers serves on the Comtrea Board and the Jefferson County Community Mental Health Fund Board. The sales tax monies that Comtrea receives flow through the Jefferson County Community Mental Health Fund Board. The Board members are not compensated.

Martha Maxwell serves on the Comtrea Board and the Jefferson County Community Mental Health Fund Board. The sales tax monies that Comtrea receives flow through the Jefferson County Community Mental Health Fund Board. The Board members are not compensated.

Stephen Huss is the President/CEO of Comtrea and serves on the Behaviorial Health Response (BHR) Board who provides Access Crisis Intervention Intervention for Comtrea. Dr. Huss is not compensated for serving on the BHR Board.

Kathryn Ellis serves on the Comtrea Board and the Jefferson County Community Mental Health Fund Board. The sales tax monies that Comtrea receives flow through the Jefferson County Community Mental Health Fund Board. The Board members are not compensated.

Steven Crawford serves on the Comtrea Board and the Jefferson County Community Mental Health Fund Board. The sales tax monies that Comtrea receives flow through the Jefferson County Community Mental Health Fund Board. The Board members are not compensated.

Catherine Whitlock serves on the Comtrea Board and the Jefferson County Community Mental Health Fund Board. The sales tax monies that Comtrea receives flow through the Jefferson County Community Mental Health Fund Board. The Board members are not compensated.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Board of Directors, President/CEO and VP/CFO review Comtrea's Form 990 before it is filed with the IRS. The VP/CFO will send a draft of Comtrea's completed Form 990 to all members of the Board via email with a return request at least 14 days prior to filing the return. The return receipts will be filed with the copy of the Form 990. The Board will provide feedback to the VP/CFO within 7 days of receipt as to any known inaccuracies or questions. A formal review will be done after the Board's review period has lapsed to allown inclusion of all Board members comments. Prior to filing, a member of the Finance/Audit Committee, President/CEO and VP/CFO will conduct a formal review of Comtrea's completed Form 990.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Annually, each manager and board of director member will complete a conflict of interest statement and code of ethics declaration to be submitted to the Board Members and CEO by July 1.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Board annually reviews the fairness of the CEO compensation and benefits in relation to industry practices and federal requirements. The policy of Comtrea is to provide compensation that is fair, reasonable and consistent with compensation paid in the nonprofit sector for positions of comparable complexity and responsibility. The compensation of the staff is approved by the Board of Directors in its annual Strategic Plan and Budget meeting. The Finance Committee ensures that the bases upon which the compensation recommendations and decisions are made are well justified, reasonable and documented.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements are available to the public upon request.
